content:
Voici une version optimisée du script :
```batch
@echo off
echo.
echo ==========================================================================
echo    GenerateService.bat
echo    Runs generation scripts for the SaphirService Project
echo    With Shared Entities...
echo    SEFI compatible
echo ==========================================================================
echo.

@rem User specific settings
set saphirPath=E:\Source\Repos\Saphir\Saphir\
set saphirServicePath=E:\Source\Repos\Saphir\SaphirService\
set servicePath=%saphirPath%\ServiceClient\Service.cs
set tmpServicePath=%servicePath%.tmp.cs
set backupServicePath=%servicePath%.old
set bolPath=%saphirServicePath%\BOL\bin\Debug\
set port=6800
set vsDir="C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2017\Professional\Common7\IDE"
set svcUtilDir="C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft SDKs\Windows\v10.0A\bin\NETFX 4.8 Tools"
@set PATH=%PATH%;%vsDir%;%svcUtilDir%

@rem Some var for time in batch
set try=0
set stH=%TIME:~0,2%
set stM=%TIME:~3,2%
set stS=%TIME:~6,2%
set stC=%TIME:~9,2%
echo StartTime: %stH%:%stM%:%stS%:%stC%

:run
set /A try+=1
@echo Generate try: %try%
svcutil /t:code http://localhost:%port%/service /out:%tmpServicePath% /nologo /noConfig /ct:System.Collections.Generic.List`1 /r:%bolPath%Shared.dll /r:%bolPath%SefiSecurity.dll /r:%saphirServicePath%\Entities\bin\Debug\Entities.dll /r:%saphirServicePath%ServiceException\bin\Debug\ServiceException.dll /r:%saphirServicePath%packages\EntityFramework.6.4.4\lib\net45\EntityFramework.dll /r:%saphirServicePath%Rubis/bin/Debug/Rubis.dll
@echo Return code : %errorLevel%
@if errorlevel 1 goto :error

@rem Exit label
:exit
del %backupServicePath%
move %servicePath% %backupServicePath%
move %tmpServicePath% %servicePath%
echo.
echo ==========================================================================
@echo DONE !
echo ==========================================================================
echo.
echo StartTime: %stH%:%stM%:%stS%:%stC%
set etH=%TIME:~0,2%
set etM=%TIME:~3,2%
set etS=%TIME:~6,2%
set etC=%TIME:~9,2%
echo EndTime: %etH%:%etM%:%etS%:%etC%

set /A STARTTIME=(1%stH%-100)*360000 + (1%stM%-100)*6000 + (1%stS%-100)*100 + (1%stC%-100)
set /A ENDTIME=(1%etH%-100)*360000 + (1%etM%-100)*6000 + (1%etS%-100)*100 + (1%etC%-100)
set /A DURATION=%ENDTIME%-%STARTTIME%

set /A DURATIONH=%DURATION% / 360000
set /A DURATIONM=(%DURATION% - (%DURATIONH%*360000)) / 6000
set /A DURATIONS=(%DURATION% -
```
